intro: Breynia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered breynia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces showy, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. Breynia grandiflora is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
